text.0: he who sate down as hotarpriest the Ṛṣi our father offering up all things existing.
text.1: he seeking through his wish a great possession came among men on earth as archetypal.
text.2: what was the place whereon he took his station what was it that supported him how was it.
text.3: whence visvakarman seeing all producing the earth with mighty power disclosed the heavens.
text.4: he who hath eyes on all sides round about him a mouth on all sides arms and feet on all sides.
text.5: he the sole god producing earth and heaven weldeth them with his arms as wings together.
text.6: what was the tree what wood in sooth produced it from which they fashioned out the earth and heaven.
text.7: ye thoughtful men inquire within your spirit whereon he stood when he established all things.
text.8: nine highest lowest sacrificial natures and these thy midmost here o visvakarman.
text.9: teach thou thy friends at sacrifice o blessed and come thyself exalted to our worship.
text.10: bring thou thyself exalted with oblation o visvakarman earth and heaven to worship.
text.11: let other men around us live in folly here let us have a rich and liberal patron.
text.12: let us invoke today to aid our labour the lord of speech the thoughtswift visvakarman.
text.13: may he hear kindly all our invocations who gives all bliss for aid whose works are righteous.
